attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
AOL today reports - 

"Plans for future of US forces in Iraq are part of 'ongoing process', which of course is great. The petitioner is urging the P.M. to support   
Lieutenant Colonel Todd Vician, a spokesman for the US Department of Defence, who comments that the US was not seeking permanent military bases in Iraq, despite a confidential draft agreement emerging which showed provision was being made for an open-ended military presence in the country.

The petitioner is calling on the cabinet to seek clarification on this draft strategic framework agreement between the US and Iraqi governments, obtained by The Guardian.

The undersigned agree that in accordance with the new anti - terror measures proposed, "to detain individuals when necessary for imperative reasons of security" without time limit, as the newspaper reported.I urge the MOD to set a strategic time limit or restriction on the US and other coalition forces - including the British - in the country, remembering that the UN mandate expires at the end of the year.
